Headlines: Chaos in Central African Republic Imperils Aid Groups’ Work
Snippets: Mayhem is spreading, tens of thousands of people have been displaced, and aid groups warn that “we cannot operate in a country where we are the target.”

Headlines: Win a Trip in 2018!
Snippets: Apply to win a reporting trip to the developing world.

Headlines: The Most Dangerous Places for Children in 2017
Snippets: Unicef has warned of a “shocking scale” of attacks against children. Here is our coverage from countries racked by violence.

Headlines: Forced From Their Village by Violence
Snippets: In northwest Central African Republic, an armed rebel group has burned villages to the ground, displacing thousands. Listen to the voices of those who fled the violence.

Headlines: A Mission to Capture or Kill Joseph Kony Ends, Without Capturing or Killing
Snippets: A small group of Ugandan and American military officials will hold a ceremony to celebrate the end of the mission to capture Mr. Kony, the head of the Lord’s Resistance Army.

Headlines: Ordered to Catch a Warlord, Ugandan Troops Are Accused of Hunting Girls
Snippets: As Uganda prepares to withdraw forces from a mission in the Central African Republic, they leave behind troubling reports of sexual abuses.

Headlines: Smuggled, Beaten and Drugged: The Illicit Global Ape Trade
Snippets: The New York Times tracked international ape smugglers from Congolese rain forests to the back streets of Bangkok. Here is what unfolded.

Headlines: Suspected Cases of Ebola Rise to 29 in Democratic Republic of Congo
Snippets: Aid workers are trying to reach a remote part of the country, where there have been three deaths from the virus.

Headlines: Hunt for Joseph Kony, No Longer Seen as a Threat, May Shrink
Snippets: The Pentagon wants to shift to a more narrow pursuit of Mr. Kony, the African warlord whose guerrilla group gained notoriety for its use of child soldiers.

Headlines: Louis Sarno Dies at 62; Moved to Africa to Preserve Ancestral Music
Snippets: An American who became a cultural go-between for generations of Bayaka people.
